tweets.text: @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @NewsNBC this tweet pretty much sums it up... when will Red Industries mismanagement of Walleys Quarry be addressed?  @StinkStopthe https://t.co/ZpBpaZ7xcS

@riverroding @midiwife Ah, roll on summer! We'd hoped to see a kingfisher, a splash of colour against the drab winter tones, but no luck on this trip. BTW, part of the re-enforced riverbank has collapsed in Ilford. No threat to navigation & reported to @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/fPEJNEhumD
@iantokelove @midiwife Looks like a great adventure. This view looks very different in the winter- you can see almost exactly the same view in our background picture and it’s much more verdant

Having done more digging @TheBoltonNews @ChrisGeeLDR it appears @HorwichC DEFERRED making a decision March 2019 awaiting @EnvAgencyNW and @NaturalEngland comments. @boltoncouncil then never sent it back to @HorwichC. Very poor form! https://t.co/tcx2ytPa0r
@lyell_tweed @TheBoltonNews @ChrisGeeLDR @boltoncouncil these are the minutes of @HorwichC Planning for December 2020 from the website? 🤔 2/2 https://t.co/nSHgcdCG6U

@RedIndustries2 Congratulations Nigel on your promotion within an organisation that destroys the quality of life for local people, defiling the local cemetery and sending an appalling stink across local schools, playgrounds and nurseries.  Great contribution to the community.
@RussellB1ggs @EnvAgencyAnglia Lots of issues there then! The diesel needs a bund and it will have to meet requirements. Have @EnvAgencyAnglia got back you you?

@stoatweaselcare @EnvAgencyAnglia I assume it’s the water filtration system and not even sure if they have a permit to take the water from the Chalkstream  It is as you point out run with Diesel & seems stupid to place everything so close to this once pristine Chalkstream🤬photos 4 weeks ago😱 https://t.co/SjzZBPldZN
@SophieJTankard @wildacademy @slowtheflow_UK @Ragsie123 @rggeo @EnvAgencyYNE @nationaltrust @Calderdale Thank you! We will def have to have a catch up soon, can't wait to hear your stories.

This is unsurprising but still deeply disappointing. If @EnvAgency can't or won't enforce their own pollution rules, our rivers pay the price. 
https://t.co/qiZgZrTWC7

@Dr_H_Glanville @wildacademy @slowtheflow_UK @Ragsie123 @rggeo @EnvAgencyYNE @nationaltrust @Calderdale Gosh! It sounds like your not able to catch a break! Its sounds like really hard work right now!  Let me know if I can help in any way I am more than happy to help. Thank you! It was only possible with your support and I learnt from the best ❤

This upcoming online event, 'Youth Voice Summit: Rethinking Water' is a fantastic opportunity for young people to engage with environmental decision makers 👏 Tuesday 16th March. Confirm your attendance 👉 https://t.co/LE7Np7PQW4 @EnvAgency @natyouthagency @OBrightFuture

#TeamEA have been working to reduce flood risk in #Warrington today

Here's our #BeforeDuringAfter showing our teams removing debris from Padgate Brook Warrington

#ReducingFloodRisk https://t.co/Uh5k0falGX

@SophieJTankard @wildacademy @slowtheflow_UK @Ragsie123 @rggeo @EnvAgencyYNE @nationaltrust @Calderdale Things feeling a tad relentless at the mo, not really able to catch a break at the mo, just when i think I'm close to catching up, more things come my way. This is the 4th weekend in a row I've had to work ffs. Still great to see your continual success 🙌

This is the trashtrap where the River Brent meets Welsh Harp Reservoir, a Site of Special Scientific Interest. Met a guy from @EnvAgency clearing it but it’s 1 wheelbarrow at a time so slow-going. They won’t touch beyond the trap bcus it’s not their remit. But sadly…
Thread 1/4 https://t.co/1864MeLcP9

3 years ago an oil slick polluted the River Lea. 
It exposed the lack of information given to people, putting them & the environment at greater risk.
So it was brilliant @EnvAgencySE set up alerts for serious incidents across North London.
It seems the service will end in March. https://t.co/zjb9gVFLUw

Fishery officers are patrolling in #WestSussex to check if #anglers have a #RodFishingLicence. Although many still waters are frozen there are still anglers about. So far one has been reported for fishing without a licence. You can buy a licence https://t.co/IfgjAeOK0Z https://t.co/kPJYxe3Uy0

urls.title: Guest post: How global warming is making power plants produce less electricity | Carbon Brief
urls.description: The coal, gas and nuclear power plants that generate most of the world’s electricity have to be kept cool in order to function properly. However, this will be increasingly challenging as the world gets warmer.

tweets.text:
"In thermal power plants, just 30-50% of the energy stored in the coal, gas or nuclear fuel is used to generate electricity. The rest of the energy is dissipated as heat – & lots of it"
#SayNo2SizewellC @KwasiKwarteng @annietrev  @beisgovuk @EnvAgency 
https://t.co/AQjVDjv0gh

tweets.text:
Since June we have been doing an e-newsletter every month for our #volunteers & #members. You can now see them all on our website: https://t.co/fE2knaK6ki 
We've started to include articles from our friends around the catchment. January's was an excellent article by @ProfJGrey! https://t.co/qAFseGHDHV

Has now been investigated fully by @EnvAgency, - can’t go into detail here but I’m very satisfied with the quick and thorough response from the officer and action taken + feedback given https://t.co/jnF0r6ZXSS
This river is in full flood after heavy rainfall/snowmelt & remains crystal clear https://t.co/1NVSp9Ecyd

A relic of the past🧐or a Blueprint for all our Chalkstreams if allowed to flow through meadows and woodland 🥰20m riparian buffers🥰LWD🥰no CSO’s💩no Agricultural/Road runoff & connection with the floodplains & free from over abstraction🥰 @theriverstrust https://t.co/CZ4a3en4qz
Good to see some positive feedback about the @EnvAgency  - was just saying this morning how you usually only hear them mentioned when people are unhappy. https://t.co/b5rF5NzgQN

urls.title: Fostering Prosperity: driving innovation and creating market opportunities through environmental regulations
urls.description: Join us on 2 March 2021 at 9.30am - 11am for the launch of Aldersgate Group’s latest report, Fostering Prosperity, which focuses on how environmental regulation can accelerate business innovation, create new market opportunities, and promote job creation. The UK has set commendable objectives on the climate and environmental agenda. In addition to its target to produce net zero emissions by 2050, the UK is committed to overturning the decline in the natural environment within a generation, improving the

tweets.text: As the government sets up a taskforce on regulatory review, @AldersgateGrp will launch its next report on 2 March looking at the economic benefits that environmental regulations have had in sectors such as #construction, #transport & #waste / resources: https://t.co/MECbyTYwnf https://t.co/hegdf65Z5R

tweets.text:
@estrellasadie I was going to say expense and/or pollution but having looked them up, neither applies. In fact, they are used for flood protection in some places. Why not here? - no idea. 
@EnvAgency

Just remembered when we went to the STEM fair, and a group of kids had invented flood bags filled with Orbeez, and showed how much better they were at containing flood water than sand bags. Those kids were awesome, and why aren't we using them? 🤔
